title: Saudi Authorities Widen Security Crackdown After Detaining Two Rivals to Crown Prince
summary: Sweep has sent a chill across the leadership in Saudi Arabia. DUBAI-Saudi Arabian Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman has embarked on a broad security crackdown by rounding up royal rivals, government officials and military officers in an effort to quash potential challenges to his power, Saudi royals and advisers familiar with the matter said Saturday.

title: Boeing CEO Expresses Regret Over Criticisms of Leadership and Predecessor
summary: He tells executives they have his support despite sometimes harsh comments. Boeing Chief Executive Dave Calhoun told executives that he regretted voicing criticisms of the company's leadership and former CEO in an interview with the New York Times this past week.

title: States Fight Coronavirus Spread
Coronavirus Checks Mean Confusion, Boredom on Cruise Ship Stuck off San Francisco
summary: More than 3,500 passengers and crew await test results; 'None of us knew what was going on'. SAN FRANCISCO-The Grand Princess cruise ship was headed to Ensenada, Mexico, after visiting Hawaii when the word came down to passengers: The 951-foot vessel was diverting immediately to its home port here due to "unexpected events."

title: How Many People Will Get Sick From the Coronavirus? Scientists Model Answers
summary: Scientists quietly see a best-case scenario of tens of thousands of deaths; 10 million over two years is the worst case. The coronavirus has so far infected more than 100,000 people around the world and killed almost 3,500 as of Friday. The question that scientists are scrambling to figure out is how far and fast it will spread and how deadly it could become.

title: Hall & Oates on the Breakups Behind 'She's Gone'
summary: Resume Subscription. When Hall & Oates first released "She's Gone" in 1973 on Atlantic, the single only reached No. 60 on Billboard's pop chart.

title: March Madness Will Go On, but in a Worst Case, Without Mad Fans
summary: As coronavirus spreads around the U.S., the NCAA's marquee basketball tournaments are slated to begin in less than two weeks. The NCAA's worst-case scenario for staging its March Madness tournaments in the time of coronavirus involves barring spectators from games, with players screened for illness before competing, the association's chief medical officer Brian Hainline said in an interview with The Wall Street Journal.

title: Entertainment Companies Will Test Delayed Gratification
summary: As conferences, concerts and movie releases get delayed, questions build about when demand returns. Epidemics aren't a great time to be in the business of drawing big crowds into tight spaces.

title: Why More Car Makers Are Following Tesla Into the Battery Business
summary: Investing in cell production is the only way that GM and its peers see to make electric vehicles affordable. General Motors is going "all in on batteries," it said this week, and so are other big car makers. Investors likely won't see rewards for years.

title: Coronavirus Outbreak Stymies New York Budget Debate
summary: With state budget due April 1, lobbying in Albany would normally be ramping up. ALBANY, N.Y.-Health-care providers had planned a major trip to the State Capitol on Wednesday to push lawmakers about why they shouldn't reduce Medicaid spending by $2.5 billion-a key issue in the state budget debate.

title: Critical Component of Protective Masks in Short Supply
summary: The epidemic has driven up demand for material in N95 filters; 'everyone thinks there is this magic factory somewhere'.

title: 'Madame d'Ora' Review: Approaching Photography as a Dramaturge
summary: Dora Kallmus, better known as Madame d'Ora, was a talented portraitist who found theatrical spectacle in many of her subjects.

title: A Couple New Yorkers Capitalize on 'Slime'
summary: Experience-based businesses build their brand first, then sell merchandise. Karen Robinovitz and Sara Schiller knew they wanted to build a business around "slime," and for the past year they have been throwing goo around to see what would stick.

title: Amid Market Chaos, Strategies for Your Retirement Savings
summary: How to limit the impact on your portfolio if you're in or near retirement.

title: Nursing Home at Center of Washington Coronavirus Outbreak Target of Criticism
summary: Family members of the facility's residents seek answers about how loved ones are being cared for-and what is being done to limit future cases. KIRKLAND, Wash.-Washington state officials are considering taking over a nursing home tied to 10 deaths in the Covid-19 outbreak after the facility's owners drew criticism from local officials and families for spotty and at times chaotic dissemination of information.

title: Wall Street and White House Diverge on Coronavirus
summary: Two starkly different views on ability to contain crisis add to sense of anxiety. In Washington, the coronavirus is serious but manageable and the economy is solid. On Wall Street, it is a full-blown crisis that will cause a deep recession and seriously damage global trade.

title: China's Exports Plunge Amid Coronavirus Epidemic
summary: Country's exports drop 17.2%, marking the sharpest contraction in nearly a year.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: We Actually Know What We Should Eat
summary: The constant noise of new diet theories can make every choice seem wrong, but there are tried-and-true ways to achieve good nutrition. "How should I eat?" is a question that many Americans ask daily. Almost everyone seems confused, and no wonder: Splashy new diet theories appear all the time, often countering what we took to be true just yesterday.

title: In a Flash, Democrats' Race Is Back Where It Began
summary: After South Carolina, five candidates quit the race, until it was down to the two who led national polls at the beginning-Biden and Sanders. A week of shock waves has left the Democratic primary race right back where it started.

title: Lebanon to Default on Dollar-Denominated Debt
summary: Bonds with a face value of $1.2 billion due Monday. Lebanon said it would default on its dollar-denominated debt, intensifying the Middle Eastern state's financial turmoil and setting up a possibly messy negotiation with foreign investors.

title: How Germany's 1930s Bauhaus Design Transformed Tel Aviv's Cityscape
summary: A tenant of a Chicago glass tower by Mies van der Rohe visits Tel Aviv, a city packed with thousands of examples of the minimalist Bauhaus style. IT WAS a curious confluence of events that transformed me into a fangirl of the Bauhaus , the German design school that architect Walter Gropius founded in 1919.

title: Smile! Your Boss Is Tracking Your Happiness.
summary: Most Popular News. Your company wants to know what type of mood you are in today.

title: Is Coronavirus the Beginning of the End for Global Auto Shows?
summary: The 90th Geneva International Motor Show was canceled when WSJ car columnist Dan Neil was enroute to Switzerland. With such events already facing dwindling attendance, the future looks uncertain. THE PLAN WAS to fly into London, pick up a right-hand-drive McLaren GT at Woking, in Surrey, then drive to Geneva for the annual auto show's press days, scheduled to begin Monday, March 2. Later I had arranged to take a Ferrari GTC4Lusso over the Alps to Maranello, Italy, for a tour of Ferrari's new design studio with ace penholder Flavio Manzoni. I had also booked some seat time in the new Roma coupe at the company's test track at Fiorano.

title: The Virus Aftermath Won't Be Like a Hurricane
summary: Even if recession is avoided, recovery is likely to be U-shaped and uncomfortably long. When a hurricane rolls in, a river breaches its levee or suddenly shifting tectonic plates shake the earth, the economy can experience a big hit. The ensuing recovery is often even bigger.

title: Coronavirus Cases Exceed 100,000 as Countries Struggle to Contain Spread
summary: Death toll in U.S. jumped to 16 Friday, with fatalities in Seattle area and Florida. The number of confirmed coronavirus cases globally topped 100,000 on Friday, as infections spread to new parts of the U.S. where officials struggled to get the epidemic under control.

title: Trump Says Rep. Mark Meadows to Take Over as White House Chief of Staff
summary: Mick Mulvaney, acting chief of staff of 14 months, to serve as U.S. special envoy for Northern Ireland. President Trump said late Friday that he is replacing Mick Mulvaney, his acting chief of staff of 14 months, with Rep. Mark Meadows, a longtime ally and frequent defender of his on Capitol Hill.

title: U.S. Trade Officials Grant Tariff Relief for Face Masks, Medical Equipment
summary: Exclusions are approved for 27 companies in light of coronavirus outbreak. WASHINGTON-The Trump administration has granted exclusions from import tariffs for more than 100 medical items imported from China, including face masks, examination gloves and sanitizing wipes.

title: Trump Signs Coronavirus Spending Bill
summary: Bill funds vaccine development efforts, sends money to state and local governments to assist response. WASHINGTON-President Trump signed into law an $8.3 billion bill for fighting the coronavirus outbreak, funding efforts to develop a vaccine and assisting local and state governments' responses, as officials said they were also weighing steps to bolster the U.S. economy.

title: Former Alstom Executive Sentenced to 15 Months in Prison
summary: Lawrence Hoskins's sentence on money-laundering charges comes nearly seven years after he was first indicted in the U.S.. A former Alstom SA executive was sentenced to 15 months in prison on money-laundering charges related to a scheme to bribe Indonesian officials.

title: Justice Department Rejects Judge's Criticism of How Barr Handled Mueller Report
summary: Federal judge said in ruling Thursday that Barr put forward 'distorted' and 'misleading' account of Mueller findings. WASHINGTON-The Justice Department on Friday said a federal judge's criticisms of Attorney General William Barr's handling of the special counsel Robert Mueller's Russia investigation "were contrary to the facts."

title: California Steals Its Own Election
summary: Voting reforms create an electoral mess and deny Sanders a bigger win.. Bernie Sanders supporters who complain that the Democratic primary contest is rigged may have an ironic point. Look how he was denied what might have been a bigger victory in California on Super Tuesday that would have countered Joe Biden's Eastern U.S. rout narrative. Blame incompetent progressive government.

title: Hachette Cancels Woody Allen Memoir Following Staff Protests
summary: Dozens of staffers on Thursday walked out in support of Mr. Allen's son, Ronan Farrow. Lagardère SCA's Hachette Book Group on Friday said it had canceled Woody Allen's memoir, one day after an estimated 75 to 100 Hachette employees walked out of their offices in protest of the coming title.

title: Fear and Hope Week
summary: The jobs report shows the economy was strong before the virus shock.. The contrast between economic past and future has rarely been more stark than it was this week as the coronavirus panic contrasted with what has been a strong underlying economy.

title: The 'No Bail' Fiasco in New York
summary: Crime is breaking out again amid a get-out-of-jail-free law.. You know New York has a problem when even Mayor Bill de Blasio admits it. On Thursday the New York Police Department held a press conference to report that major crime is up 22.5% this February over a year ago. Both the cops and the mayor attribute the spike to the bail reform pushed through the state Legislature in Albany last year, which is releasing people who have been arrested for one crime to go out and commit another.

title: Judge Walton's Political Aside
summary: He gets his facts wrong in a broadside against unpopular Bill Barr.. Judges aren't shy about criticizing prosecutors when they are displeased. But few would go as far as federal Judge Reggie Walton, who on Thursday used a procedural ruling to offer a needless and inaccurate opinion that seems dubiously political.
